derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'personify'): from in- 'into' + Latin persona 'person', on the pattern of incorporate

entry.def: If someone impersonates a person, they pretend to be that person, either to deceive people or to make people laugh.

example.ex: He was returned to prison in 1977 for impersonating a police officer...
example.tran: 他 1977 年因冒充警官而再次入狱。

example.ex: Tom was a brilliant mimic who could impersonate most of the college staff.
example.tran: 汤姆的模仿能力是超一流的，他能惟妙惟肖地模仿学院里的大多数老师。

means.word_mean: 1. assume or act the character of;

sentences.sentence: "The actor portrays an elderly, lonely man"

means.word_mean: 2. represent another person with comic intentions
3. pretend to be someone you are not; sometimes with fraudulent intentions;

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"向内,成为,进入,使……"; 2. 表示"不,无,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: im向内,成为,进入,使……+passion激情+ed……的→adj.慷慨激昂的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+plic重叠+it→进入重叠→不直说→储蓄的
im不,无,非+moral道德的→adj.不道德的
im不,无,非+partial有偏见的→adj.公平的
im不,无,非+pecc斑点+able……的→无斑点的
im不,无,非+possible可能的→adj.不可能的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+migrate移居→入住
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pel推→推进,驱动
im向内,成为,进入,使……+peril危险→v.使处于危险中
im向内,成为,进入,使……+person人+ate表动词→进入别人→扮演别人
im向内,成为,进入,使……+prison监狱→v.监禁
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pulse跳动→内在推动→冲动

sentences.en: I ought to be arrested for impersonating an officer.
